abstracts.cdata!:
The Enterprise Institution Building Loan
            for Uzbekistan had the following ratings: the outcome was
            highly unsatisfactory, the sustainability was unlikely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: Lack of government ownership
            undermines the effectiveness of even the best intentioned
            and designed operation. While risk taking during design
            should be encouraged, the Bank should not hesitate to draw
            back if an innovation fails. Technical Assistance is an
            expensive vehicle for policy dialogue when lack of political
            will rather than capacity is the key constraint on reform.
            There is a need, however, to reconsider how to best deliver
            technical assistance in environments such as Uzbekistan. In
            the context of uncertain or limited Government ownership,
            reluctance of the Borrower to restructure may reflect
            concern over internal reprisals rather than continued
            ownership and drive to deliver.
